result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis Lamond Gamble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Court advised defendasnt of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never poossess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Complete a parenting class.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
*9/25/2015 STAY LIFTED.  To serve 30 days, straight time, forthwith.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis Lamond Gamble

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dennis Lamond Gamble in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Dennis Lamond Gamble in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Matter set for restitution hearing.  State has not received any information from the victim.  Court ordered resitution set at $0.00.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for restitution hearing.  Victim cannot appear as she had to work.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis Lamond Gamble in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Dennis Lamond Gamble in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
*
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 28 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 28 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Dennis Lamond Gamble not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bil hearing waived by the defense.  Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.D.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dennis Lamond Gamble in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Dennis Lamond Gamble in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
